2021-09-16.name: Michigan Irish Music Festival
2021-09-16.summary: There's music on three stages, plus dance and session tents, a cultural village, Celtic Kitchen and limerick contest.

2021-09-17.name: Michigan Irish Music Festival
2021-09-17.summary: There's music on three stages, plus dance and session tents, a cultural village, Celtic Kitchen and limerick contest.

2021-09-17.name: Unplugged music festival
2021-09-17.summary: The harbor-side North House Folk School celebrates with storytelling, traditional workshops, a fish boil and  concerts by songwriter/musicians.

2021-09-17.name: Oktoberfestival
2021-09-17.summary: This festival on the bayfront features stein-holding, barrel-rolling and pretzel-tossing contests, a kids' zone and a dachshund derby on Sunday, plus German food and music. Admission is $20, $10 up to week of event, free for youths 15 and under.

2021-09-18.name: Michigan Irish Music Festival
2021-09-18.summary: There's music on three stages, plus dance and session tents, a cultural village, Celtic Kitchen and limerick contest.

2021-09-18.name: Unplugged music festival
2021-09-18.summary: The harbor-side North House Folk School celebrates with storytelling, traditional workshops, a fish boil and  concerts by songwriter/musicians.

2021-09-18.name: Oktoberfestival
2021-09-18.summary: This festival on the bayfront features stein-holding, barrel-rolling and pretzel-tossing contests, a kids' zone and a dachshund derby on Sunday, plus German food and music. Admission is $20, $10 up to week of event, free for youths 15 and under.

2021-09-18.name: World War II Days
2021-09-18.summary: Midway Village Museum hosts one of the largest World War II battle re-enactments in the nation, with more than 1,200 uniformed re-enactors and more than 60 vintage tanks and other armored vehicles.

2021-09-18.name: Bacon Bash
2021-09-18.summary: There will be pig races, a pig-calling contest, pig crafts, an amateur bacon cook-off and many bacon dishes, including ice cream.

2021-09-18.name: Audubon Days
2021-09-18.summary: The festival in this town next to big Horicon Marsh             features bed races, a car show, craft fair, bag tournament and music.

2021-09-18.name: Parade of Nations and Multicultural Festival
2021-09-18.summary: The parade begins in Hancock and ends in Houghton at Dee Stadium, where there's a festival with music, dancing and food from around the world.

2021-09-18.name: Museum Day
2021-09-18.summary: Smithsonian magazine and participating museums in every state offer free admission for two people. Tickets are available for download on the website.

2021-09-18.name: Greenway Glow
2021-09-18.summary: Along the Midtown Greenway bike route in south Minneapolis, enjoy live music, art installations and theatrical performances from 4 to 10 p.m.

2021-09-18.name: Squidfest
2021-09-18.summary: The inaugural festival in this Minnesota River Valley town features a 10:30 a.m. parade, a disc golf tournament, street performance, kids' activities, art and live music all day. There's also a Ribfest.

2021-09-19.name: Michigan Irish Music Festival
2021-09-19.summary: There's music on three stages, plus dance and session tents, a cultural village, Celtic Kitchen and limerick contest.

2021-09-19.name: Oktoberfestival
2021-09-19.summary: This festival on the bayfront features stein-holding, barrel-rolling and pretzel-tossing contests, a kids' zone and a dachshund derby on Sunday, plus German food and music. Admission is $20, $10 up to week of event, free for youths 15 and under.

2021-09-19.summary: Midway Village Museum hosts one of the largest World War II battle re-enactments in the nation, with more than 1,200 uniformed re-enactors and more than 60 vintage tanks and other armored vehicles.

2021-09-19.name: Bacon Bash
2021-09-19.summary: There will be pig races, a pig-calling contest, pig crafts, an amateur bacon cook-off and many bacon dishes, including ice cream.

2021-09-10.name: Paw Paw Wine & Harvest Festival
2021-09-10.summary: This big festival in southwest Michigan wine country features music on three stages, Friday fireworks, an art fair, motorcycle and bicycle tours, grape stomps and a Sunday parade.

2021-09-10.name: Pitchfork Music Festival
2021-09-10.summary: This indie and alt-rock festival is in Union Park.

2021-09-10.name: Grand Rapids Riverfest
2021-09-10.summary: This inaugural music festival downtown features Trampled by Turtles, Yonder Mountain String Band, The Brothers Burn Mountain and Charlie Parr.

2021-09-11.name: Paw Paw Wine & Harvest Festival
2021-09-11.summary: This big festival in southwest Michigan wine country features music on three stages, Friday fireworks, an art fair, motorcycle and bicycle tours, grape stomps and a Sunday parade.

2021-09-11.name: Pitchfork Music Festival
2021-09-11.summary: This indie and alt-rock festival is in Union Park.

2021-09-11.name: Grand Rapids Riverfest
2021-09-11.summary: This inaugural music festival downtown features Trampled by Turtles, Yonder Mountain String Band, The Brothers Burn Mountain and Charlie Parr.

2021-09-11.name: Rock Bend Folk Festival
2021-09-11.summary: This free, easygoing festival is in this Minnesota River town's Minnesota Square Park.

2021-09-11.name: Washington County Bluegrass Festival
2021-09-11.summary: Bluegrass bands will play at this family festival at Lake Elmo Park Reserve at the eastern edge of the Twin Cities, free with $7 vehicle permit. There also will be camping and food vendors.

2021-09-11.name: Sputnikfest
2021-09-11.summary: Help celebrate the 1962 crash landing of a 20-pound piece of Russia's Sputnik on a street in Manitowoc. There's a wacky costume contest, a Miss Space Debris pageant, a pet costume contest, a space-themed movie and music.

2021-09-11.name: Whooping Crane Festival
2021-09-11.summary: Celebrate the whooping-crane migration with voyageur canoe trips, a marketplace, crane trivia, children's activities and bird walks.

2021-09-11.name: Radio Waves Music Festival
2021-09-11.summary: WTIP, North Shore Community Radio, hosts this outdoor fest of more than 25 local and regional music acts next to the municipal campground.

2021-09-11.name: Younger Brothers Capture
2021-09-11.summary: This entertaining festival reenacts the bank robbery, gunflight and capture of the Younger Brothers the week after their infamous raid on Northfield. Spectators in period costume can join reenactors on Main Street.

2021-09-11.name: Monarch Festival
2021-09-11.summary: This festival at Lake Nokomis celebrates the monarch migration from Minnesota to Mexico and includes a costume parade, music, dance, art activities and monarch games.

2021-09-12.name: Paw Paw Wine & Harvest Festival
2021-09-12.summary: This big festival in southwest Michigan wine country features music on three stages, Friday fireworks, an art fair, motorcycle and bicycle tours, grape stomps and a Sunday parade.

2021-09-12.name: Pitchfork Music Festival
2021-09-12.summary: This indie and alt-rock festival is in Union Park.

2021-09-12.name: Rock Bend Folk Festival
2021-09-12.summary: This free, easygoing festival is in this Minnesota River town's Minnesota Square Park.

2021-09-04.name: Fox Valley Folk Music & Storytelling Festival
2021-09-04.summary: Musicians and storytellers perform on eight stages at this festival in Island Park on the Fox River.

2021-09-04.name: Marina Fest
2021-09-04.summary: In this Door County village, there will be a vintage boat show, craft fair,  kids' carnival, music and Saturday fireworks.

2021-09-05.name: Fox Valley Folk Music & Storytelling Festival
2021-09-05.summary: Musicians and storytellers perform on eight stages at this festival in Island Park on the Fox River.

2021-09-05.name: Marina Fest
2021-09-05.summary: In this Door County village, there will be a vintage boat show, craft fair,  kids' carnival, music and Saturday fireworks.

2021-09-05.name: Bike the Drive
2021-09-05.summary: Along a 30-mile loop, ride car-free on Lake Shore Drive, with a post-ride festival in Grant Park.

2021-09-06.name: Fox Valley Folk Music & Storytelling Festival
2021-09-06.summary: Musicians and storytellers perform on eight stages at this festival in Island Park on the Fox River.

2021-09-06.name: Marina Fest
2021-09-06.summary: In this Door County village, there will be a vintage boat show, craft fair,  kids' carnival, music and Saturday fireworks.

2021-09-23.name: Oktoberfest of Greater Racine
2021-09-23.summary: Lakefront Brewery hosts this free, family-friendly festival at Franksville Craft Beer Garden, featuring stein-hoisting and nail-driving contests, yard games, a pig roast, live music, bounce houses for the kids and two dozen craft beers on tap.

2021-09-24.name: Oktoberfest of Greater Racine
2021-09-24.summary: Lakefront Brewery hosts this free, family-friendly festival at Franksville Craft Beer Garden, featuring stein-hoisting and nail-driving contests, yard games, a pig roast, live music, bounce houses for the kids and two dozen craft beers on tap.

2021-09-24.name: Cornish Festival
2021-09-24.summary: In the old lead-mining district in southwest Wisconsin, play shove ha'penny in the Kiddleywink Pub, eat figgyhobbin and pasties, listen to tommyknocker tales and tour Cornish miners' cottages.

2021-09-24.name: Milwaukee Oktoberfest
2021-09-24.summary: There will be dachshund racing, stein-hoisting and brat-eating competitions as well as music and dancing at the War Memorial on the lakefront.

2021-09-24.name: Red Cliff Cultural Days
2021-09-24.summary: At this Ojibwe community just north of Bayfield, there will be a mini-powwow, sailboat rides, canoe races, traditional games, music, fireworks and sky lanterns.

2021-09-24.name: German Fest
2021-09-24.summary: There will be music, dancing, children's             games and lock and dam tours in this antebellum town on the Mississippi River.

2021-09-24.name: Kalona Fall Festival
2021-09-24.summary: This Mennonite community just southwest of Iowa City, famous for its quilts, offers pony rides, a pumpkin-carving contest, demonstrations of Old World artisanry, music and homemade potato chips, apple fritters, ice cream and chicken, biscuits and gravy.

2021-09-24.name: Octoberfest
2021-09-24.summary: This large downtown festival is more general civic celebration than German  festival, with an arts and crafts show, car show and music on five  stages.

2021-09-25.name: Oktoberfest of Greater Racine
2021-09-25.summary: Lakefront Brewery hosts this free, family-friendly festival at Franksville Craft Beer Garden, featuring stein-hoisting and nail-driving contests, yard games, a pig roast, live music, bounce houses for the kids and two dozen craft beers on tap.

2021-09-25.summary: At this Ojibwe community just north of Bayfield, there will be a mini-powwow, sailboat rides, canoe races, traditional games, music, fireworks and sky lanterns.

2021-09-25.name: All-State Barn Tour in Iowa
2021-09-25.summary: It's the Iowa Barn Foundation's annual             free, self-guided tour of restored historic barns.

2021-09-25.name: Spirit of the St. Croix Art Festival
2021-09-25.summary: Music, food and a juried art show along the St. Croix River, in Lakefront Park.

2021-09-25.name: Hyde Park Jazz Festival
2021-09-25.summary: Listen to non-stop music during this free festival at venues in and around Midway Plaisance, near the Museum of Science and Industry and Lake Michigan.

2021-09-25.name: Latino Heritage Festival
2021-09-25.summary: This festival at Western Gateway Park features Latino music, dancing, arts, cultural booths, children's activities and a corn-eating contest.

2021-09-25.name: German Fest
2021-09-25.summary: There will be music, dancing, children's             games and lock and dam tours in this antebellum town on the Mississippi River.

2021-09-25.name: Octoberfest
2021-09-25.summary: This large downtown festival is more general civic celebration than German  festival, with an arts and crafts show, car show and music on five  stages.

2021-09-25.name: Beef-A-Rama
2021-09-25.summary: In this northern Wisconsin lake-resort town, there's a Rump Roast Run, beef-eating contest and Parade of Beef.
